VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency was not required to submit any corrective action plans during this
period under review.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns based on the review of Whaley Children's Center -
Zonta House budget and financial audit dated December 31, 2020 and 2021.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not applicable.
Chief Administrator Assessment
Chief Administrator Assessment report dated June 26, 2023 was reviewed. Chief
Administrator and Zonta House leadership team found compliance with licensing
rules. Zonta House continues to utilize trauma informed care and practices. A wider
range of trauma informed training along with added trainings on suicide prevention,
working with LGBTQ+ youth, cyber security and promoting normalcy in foster care
trainings were added to their Relias training program. Therapeutic Crisis
Intervention refreshers are now offered quarterly to continue their trend in
decreasing restraints. Zonta House made the required changes for Qualified
Residential Treatment Program certification. Zonta House remains accredited
through CARF through October 2024.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff were interviewed on June 26, 2023. Staff did not report any concerns or
training needs.
3

Youth were interviewed on June 26, 2023. Youth reported feeling safe. One youth
stated he felt that he could be doing better with following redirection. This was
addressed with on duty staff. Staff reported youth was cooperative with redirection
and doing well in the program. Youth was surprised, but pleased to hear the staff's
assessment.
Description of Agency Walk Through
Onsite inspection and walk through of Zonta House and Whaley Children's Center
administrative office took place on June 26, 2023. There are no safety issues or
concerns.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
